did.unittitle: Albert G. Emerick musical copy books

scopecontent.p: Musical copy books containing transcriptions, arrangements, and original compositions by Emerick, a Philadelphia teacher and organist at St. Stephen's Church. Much of the music is liturgical and has been adopted from both Episcopal and Methodist sources. Included are 18 choral scores for hymns arranged or composed by Emerick, n. d.; transcriptions of Bach choral preludes in an earlier hand, n. d.; original and transcribed hymns, 1846, 1872-1875 (4 vols.); transcriptions of secular music, 1847-49; organ exercises, n. d.; harmonized German chorales, 1874; organ arrangement of Wagner's "Reinzi" overture, 1878; and a miscellaneous volume of church music by such American composers as Benjamin Carr, W. H. W. Darley, and Reynor Taylor, n. d.
